author: Ingar Grev
title: How a relationship management plan can grow your sales
text:
8 key basics for growing your business 
It’s often quite a learning curve to get them to even to begin to understand who their best eight clients are, their best eight prospects, their best eight referral sources, their top eight “other” relationships (employees, advisors, etc.), and the handful of other relationships that they need to manage. 
That’s crazy. Your network is a goldmine and is the cornerstone to your business development! 
Most companies, especially small businesses, drop the ball when it comes to relationship management (don’t try to hide back there, retailers; it’s just as important for you as it is to service companies). In the worst case, they have no customer relationship management software, and in the typical case, they have a poor CRM or a badly implemented one. 
I implemented Contactually when I was interim COO, and along with some sales training, we increased sales 25 percent. It ain’t rocket science — and, yes, after 10 years in the missile defense industry, I know rocket science. 
Implement a CRM and make it your home page, especially if you’re the CEO. 
What are your thoughts? Engage with me on Facebook , LinkedIn or Twitter ! Ingar Grev is the managing director of the Washington D.C.-area office of The Growth Coach.
